details.purpose: For recording the findings on physical examination of the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane by a clinician.
details.use:
Use to record the findings on physical examination of the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane by a clinician., including details of any perforation.
Specifically designed to be used within the OBSERVATION.exam-ear archetype, but may be used within any clinically appropriate ENTRY or CLUSTER archetype.
Please note: this archetype has been designed specifically to reflect current practice within the NT Hearing Health program. It is recognised that this is not currently reflecting a maximal dataset and may need to be extended in future revisions as more specific requirements are identified.
details.misuse: Not to be used to record findings of the physical examination of other parts of the ear, such as pinna and mastoid region - use other purpose-built archetypes for this purpose.

Christine Wigger, Menzies School of Health Research, Australia
description.other_details:
Communication with clinical domain experts associated with Australia's Northern Territory Hearing Health Program.
Northern Territory Government, Department of Health: Hearing Health Program ENT Specialist Consultation Form 2011 12 07.
Northern Territory Government, Department of Health: Northern Territory Hearing Health Program Teleotology Nurse Consultation Form 2011 12 07.
Northern Territory Government, Department of Health: Northern Territory Hearing Health Program Audiologist Consultation Form 2011 12 07.
OATSIH: The Recommendations for Clinical Care Guidelines on the Management of Otitis Media in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Populations (2010). Available at: http://www.health.gov.au/internet/publications/publishing.nsf/Content/CA2578620005D57ACA25792800821BE8?OpenDocument.

items.text: Examination of External Auditory Canal and Tympanic Membrane
items.description: Physical examination of the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane by a clinician.
Narrative description of findings observed by a clinician during a physical examination of the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane.
View of the tympanic membrane.
All of the tympanic membrane was visualised.
Part of the tympanic membrane was not clearly visualised, but sufficient to permit a clinical opinion to be formed.
None of the tympanic membrane visualised, such that a clinical opinion of the state of the tympanic membrane could not be formed.
Description of the reason for occlusion to the view of the tympanic membrane.
Is the tympanic membrane intact?
The tympanic membrane appears intact.
The tympanic membrane appears perforated.
Details about visibility of anatomical landmarks of the middle ear at the tympanic membrane.
Presence of a normal light reflex noted.
A normal light reflex is visible.
A normal light reflex is not visible.
Narrative description of the Annulus.
Narrative description of the Malleus Handle.
Narrative description of the Malleus Head.
Narrative description of the Umbo.
Category describing the appearance of the tympanic membrane.
The tympanic membrane appears healthy.
The tympanic membrane appears dull and opaque.
Features observed on the surface of the tympanic membrane.
Blistering is observed on the surface of the tympanic membrane.
Scarring is observed on the surface of the tympanic membrane.
Granulation is observed on the surface of the tympanic membrane.
Thickening is observed on the surface of the tympanic membrane.
Description of the overall colour of the tympanic membrane.
Description of the location of any tympanosclerosis observed on the tympanic membrane.
Description of the position of the tympanic membrane.
The tympanic membrane is in a normal, neutral position - neither bulging or retracted.
The tympanic membrane appears to be bulging.
The tympanic membrane appears to be retracted.
Description of retraction of the tympanic membrane.
Description of retraction using formal classification/grading.
Presence of a fluid level behind the tympanic membrane.
A fluid level is observed behind the tympanic membrane.
A fluid level is not observed behind the tympanic membrane.
Narrative description of the fluid level and other related features observed behind the tympanic membrane.
Description of mobility of the tympanic membrane, usually as determined by pneumatic otoscopy.
There is minimal or no movement of the tympanic membrane when positive pressure is applied.
The tympanic membrane moves with less excursion and in a more sluggish fashion when positive pressure is applied.
The tympanic membrane shows a crisp inward (medial) movement (approx 1mm) with positive pressure.
There is exaggerated movement of the tympanic membrane when positive pressure is applied.
Narrative description of the Stapes.
Narrative description of the Incus.
Details about the tympanic membrane perforation.
Details about abnormal features noted during the examination of the external auditory canal.
Estimation of the size of the tympanic membrane perforation, based on anatomical landmarks.
A pinhole perforation is present in the tympanic membrane.
A perforation is present in the tympanic membrane, that is larger than a pinhole but smaller than a subtotal perforation.
A subtotal perforation is present in the tympanic membrane: the pars tensa is absent but the perforation does not include the annulus.
A total perforation is present in the tympanic membrane; the tympanic membrane is essentially absent.
Direct measurement of the size of the tympanic membrane perforation, usually using a photograph as the source for direct measurement.
Location of the tympanic membrane perforation.
The perforation is not involving the annulus and is bounded on all sides by the remnant of the tympanic membrane.
The perforation involves the annulus of the tympanic membrane.
Description of the region of the tympanic membrane perforation.
Is an anterior perforation present?
An anterior perforation is present in the pars tensa.
An anterior perforation is not present in the pars tensa.
Narrative description of the edge of the perforation.
The discharge appears to consist mostly of clear, watery fluid.
The discharge appears to consist mostly of blood.
The discharge appears to consist mostly of pus.
The discharge appears to consist mostly of a thick, mucoid substance.
The discharge appears to consist of both mucous and pus.
The discharge appears to consist of both blood and clear, watery fluid.
Identification of the ear under examination.
The left external auditory canal and tympanic membrane.
The right external auditory canal and tympanic membrane.
Details about findings on examination of the tympanic membrane.
Single word, phrase or brief description representing a summary of the examination findings.
Description of the type of wax in the external auditory canal.
The wax is hard.
The wax is soft.
Description of the state of the wax observed in the external auditory canal.
Ear wax is tightly packed in the external auditory canal, such that it may be hard to remove or cause difficulty with hearing.
Ear wax is not tightly packed in the external auditory canal.
Presence of polyp/polyps in the external auditory canal.
Polyps are observed in the external auditory canal.
No polyps are observed in the external auditory canal.
Presence of erythema or redness in the external auditory canal.
Erythema, or redness, is observed in the wall of the external auditory canal.
There is no erythema or redness observed in the wall of the external auditory canal.
Presence of oedema in the external auditory canal.
Oedema is observed in the external auditory canal wall.
Oedema is not observed in the external auditory canal wall.
Presence of tenderness in the external auditory canal.
Tenderness is noted in the external auditory canal wall.
Tenderness is not noted in the external auditory canal wall.
Presence of any offensive odour originating from the external auditory canal.
No odour is noted as originating from the external auditory canal.
An offensive odour is noted as originating from the external auditory canal.
Presence of fungal spores in the external auditory canal.
Fungal spores are observed in the external auditory canal.
No fungal spores are observed in the external auditory canal.
Amount of discharge observed in the external auditory canal or at the tympanic membrane perforation.
No discharge is observed in the external auditory canal.
A small amount of discharge is observed in the external auditory canal.
A moderate amount of discharge is observed in the external auditory canal.
A profuse amount of discharge is observed in the external auditory canal.
Narrative description of the discharge observed in the external auditory canal or at the tympanic membrane perforation.
Type of discharge observed in the external auditory canal or at the tympanic membrane perforation.
Presence of a foreign body in the external auditory canal.
A foreign body is present in the external auditory canal.
A foreign body is present in the external auditory canal.
Location of the foreign body within the external auditory canal.
The foreign body is located in the outer part of the external auditory canal.
The foreign body is located in the deep, inner part of the external auditory canal.
Observed position of the ventilation tube (or grommet) in the tympanic membrane or the auditory canal.
The ventilation tube is located in situ in the tympanic membrane.
The ventilation tube is partially extruded from it's original position in the tympanic membrane.
The ventilation tube has been extruded from the tympanic membrane but is visualised within the external auditory canal.
The ventilation tube has been extruded from the tympanic membrane and is not visualised anywhere within the external auditory canal.
The position of the ventilation tube cannot be determined because the tympanic membrane is obscured and the ventilation tube is not observed within the external auditory canal.
Multimedia image taken during the physical examination of the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings of the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane, not captured in other fields.
White patches, consistent with tympanosclerosis, are observed on surface of the tympanic membrane.
The tympanic membrane perforation is located in the pars flaccida.
The tympanic membrane perforation is located in the pars tensa.
It is not possible to tell if the tympanic membrane is intact or perforated.
Identification of the ear under examination. (synthesised)
Description of the type of wax in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Description of the state of the wax observed in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
View of the tympanic membrane. (synthesised)
Presence of tenderness in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Presence of oedema in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Presence of erythema or redness in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Presence of any offensive odour originating from the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Type of discharge observed in the external auditory canal or at the tympanic membrane perforation. (synthesised)
Amount of discharge observed in the external auditory canal or at the tympanic membrane perforation. (synthesised)
Observed position of the ventilation tube (or grommet) in the tympanic membrane or the auditory canal. (synthesised)
Presence of polyp/polyps in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Presence of fungal spores in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Presence of a foreign body in the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Location of the foreign body within the external auditory canal. (synthesised)
Is the tympanic membrane intact? (synthesised)
Is the tympanic membrane intact? (synthesised)
Category describing the appearance of the tympanic membrane. (synthesised)
Presence of a normal light reflex noted. (synthesised)
Features observed on the surface of the tympanic membrane. (synthesised)
Description of the position of the tympanic membrane. (synthesised)
Presence of a fluid level behind the tympanic membrane. (synthesised)
Description of mobility of the tympanic membrane, usually as determined by pneumatic otoscopy. (synthesised)
Estimation of the size of the tympanic membrane perforation, based on anatomical landmarks. (synthesised)
Description of the region of the tympanic membrane perforation. (synthesised)
Location of the tympanic membrane perforation. (synthesised)
Is an anterior perforation present? (synthesised)
Multimedia image taken during the physical examination of the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane. (synthesised)
